alert.note: Alert for Giles (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 23 at 8:47AM CDT until March 24 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Richland Creek Above Pulaski affecting Giles County. For the Richland Creek...including Pulaski...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Richland Creek Above Pulaski. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding of low lying agricultural land along the river begins * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 16.2 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.6 feet this evening. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CDT.
